name: The Chasm
desc: As the saying goes, "The layered cliffs cast elusive shadows, to where treacherous roads lead, no one knows." In the ancient texts of Liyue, this place is sometimes referred to as the "Yu Valley." Even the radiant brilliance of the sun must sink into the deep shadows of dusk. Although legends remain mere legends, one should always expect the unexpected when exploring this labyrinthine underground mineshaft.

imgDesc.text:
"When I first came here, the miraculous, terrifying geography silenced me... I have never forgotten the sense of utter awe and respect that I felt."
"But even such wondrous visions became monotonous after too much hustle and bustle on behalf of the Ministry of Civil Affairs..."
"Speaking of which, I must thank the Traveler for helping me continue with my own adventure..."

"The entrance to The Chasm's mines, known to the miners as 'The Chasm's Maw.' Since the latest earthquake, the tunnels, which were already sealed by the Qixing, have been even more treacherous and inscrutable than ever..."
"But with the Traveler's help, the array sealing the opening has been broken. Let's just hope that the Qixing don't come down too hard on us..."

"This is the site of the deadly battle between Azhdaha and Rex Lapis. I'm just a young and inexperienced adventurer, and writing is not my forte... But I cannot help but stand in awe of this place."
"How small we mortals are before time, which respects neither night nor day, or gods, who can shake heaven and earth..."

"I once grew up at the mines of Mingyun Village. The miners' rowdy labor, their joys and sorrows... Those encompassed my entire childhood."
"Looking upon these underground tunnels, far more vast yet silent and deserted, these memories of yesteryear resurface in my mind... albeit sadder and more lonesome."

"The miners sealed the tunnels that led further within when they dispersed, but they did leave one 'Mountainator' here."
"Perhaps it was the orders of the higher-ups... It's not as if it would be practical to separate Liyue's mercantile pursuits from Glazed Sand Crystal for too long."

"As I was exploring by myself, I discovered this waterway. The waters here are clean and cool, perfect for taking a break and wash all the ill-fortune accumulated on the way off."
"There are some gentle elemental creatures nearby who move most slowly, rare beings who have no quarrel with the rest of the world... I drew the waterway on the map. I hope the Traveler can follow it and find this place."

"The crystal that was once here was the very same 'culprit' that caused the closure of The Chasm back then. Its strange movements have again caused the Ministry of Civil Affairs much distress."
"Fortunately, the Traveler was on hand to return it to a place deeper below, leaving us with nothing but this empty, grim hall of stone."

"As I was traveling alone, I discovered this vast and terrible ruin. Perhaps this is all that remains of an ancient civilization that was punished and destroyed. This ancient city seems to resist the presence of any outsiders... It might even have something to do with those purple-black crystals, or that mud-like substance."
"I stayed for a time, but I had to leave its ominous, upended silhouette behind."

"An underground cavern where a strange, gigantic mushroom grows. I could've sworn that I heard something strange calling to me. Perhaps it is just an illusion — or a hallucination, in which case this place must be full of poisonous gas, and I must leave as soon as possible."

"Despite the Traveler's warnings, I still followed in his/her footsteps to arrive at this place."
"I can barely comprehend the sight of this huge sky-blue crystal pillar before me. It cannot be from this continent — only the heavens, with which it shares its shade, could have been its home."
"I have decided to explore deeper within through secret paths to uncover its secrets... I wonder how far I can press on, and what further records I shall leave behind..."

It is said that this was heavy-duty engineering equipment left behind by a nation that has been destroyed. The gear system on its "head" can grind its way through even the hardest bedrock. It is said that after many years have passed, Geovishap Hatchlings will shed the armor that originally protected them and become Geovishaps. A young vishap with a hard Geo exoskeleton.
Vishaps are exceptionally agile creatures that one would be wise not to underestimate in battle. Experts from Sumeru Akademiya believe that they become dragons when fully grown. By avoiding predators and natural disasters, perhaps they can even live long enough to become formidable beasts that reign over entire mountains.

customize.desc:
Servants of the Abyss Order that use Hydro in combat.
These silent figures are the vanguard of the Abyss, brandishing Tidal Blades that can engulf everything in an instant, crumpling armor and obliterating heretics. They shall bring preordained damnation upon the foolish masses.

customize.desc:
A pitch-dark soldier. Once a proud warrior of an ancient underground nation, it is now nothing but a husk that only bears memories of battle.
All shall decay in the end, and this is all that is left of the Black Serpent Knights amidst the merciless march of their sins, curses, and time itself.

customize.name: Shadowy Husk: Standard Bearer
customize.desc:
A pitch-dark soldier. Once a proud warrior of an ancient underground nation, it has now lost any awareness of memory.
But even so, it holds the banner of the royal house aloft into battle. Though it has forgotten its comrades or any royal blessing they might have been given, it will never lay this banner down.

customize.name: Shadowy Husk: Line Breaker
customize.desc:
A pitch-dark soldier. Once a proud warrior of an ancient underground nation, it no longer has any "intelligence" that it may still be called "human."
Yet the desire to destroy the foe and plunge into battle to defend others is etched into this empty suit of armor, even if no one remains to tell it where the enemy is or who or what exactly must be defended.

customize.name: Electro Abyss Mage

Abyss creatures that utilize Electro in battles.
While studying at the Akademiya, researcher Alva Nikola once conducted a systematic study of the methods by which Electro Abyss Mages manipulate Electro and came up with a theoretical weapon known as the Nikola Coil. However, it has yet to be put into practice. Some say that his research materials were eaten during a fungal infestation.

customize.name: Cryo Abyss Mage
customize.desc:
Abyss creatures that call upon Cryo in battle.
Though they dabble with great power and can even create icicles by condensing and freezing water vapor in the atmosphere, their bodies are very vulnerable in and of themselves. Once their protective barrier has been broken, they are at your mercy.

customize.name: Hydro Abyss Mage

Abyss creatures that utilize Hydro energy in battle.
Stories circulate among adventurers that Abyss Mages are at the lowest rung of the Abyss Order's hierarchy and that they roam the various lands to scheme fell deeds of destruction. Though they also often make fun of these Abyss Mages, saying that the most harm they can do is to cause rheumatism or a common cold, their power is not to be underestimated.

customize.name: Pyro Abyss Mage

Abyss creatures who command the power of Pyro in battle.
For unknown reasons, Abyss Mages are able to communicate with the hilichurls, thus enabling them to manipulate their minds easily. They say that Abyss Mages utter a long-forgotten language from which they draw magical power.

It is said that it tastes awful. However, such fungi have lots of moisture within them, and so can be used as an emergency water source...

The Chasm is a special administrative district of Liyue located west of Lisha. Ever since the area was closed off by the Qixing a few years ago due to a mining incident, a special representative of the Ministry of Civil Affairs, Muning, has been managing all activities in the area. When he was young, he spent most of his time at the Yanshang Teahouse, where he was deeply in debt. He had no time to go and did not want to go home, but eventually, the debt collectors found his father in Shenglu Hall, and he paid off the debts. When his father found him, he was living on the streets like a beaten-up dog. Then his father said to him, <color=#ffffffd9>"I have all your IOUs, so now you're indebted to me."</color> Back when Muning spent his days hiding from debt collectors in fear and unable to sleep, he vowed that he would mend his ways if life gave him a second chance. But he did not expect that chance to come from his father, who was always dissatisfied with his behavior. In order to pay off his debt to his father, Muning joined the Ministry of Civil Affairs.

One day, his father was transporting a batch of ore in Shenglu Hall and gave his son a leftover Archaic Stone of poor quality as a toy. Archaic Stones are extremely rare ore that are not easy to find in the mines. The beauty of this magnificent gemstone is beyond imagination, and it is said that if you look inside the Archaic Stone, you will see the finest shimmering rays of light, like the horizon of the sea at dusk. When someone saw the stone in Muning's possession, they offered him a good price for it, and he sold the Archaic Stone to get some Mora. But later, his father asked him about the stone, and he reluctantly answered that he had lost it. After that conversation, Muning could not stop thinking about what would have happened if he had taken out the Archaic Stone in response to the question. During Muning's work at the Ministry, the Huishan Mining Hall became interested in the Archaic Stones and wanted to analyze them, so they sent Muning into The Chasm to get samples, but he was unable to find any. It was only with the help of the Traveler that he was able to obtain nine samples of the Archaic Stones.

When The Chasm began to experience unusual tremors from the depths, the Ministry of Civil Affairs ordered an investigation. The "thing" found in The Chasm was so unusual that it could cause panic among the population, and under the orders of the Qixing, a team of researchers and scientists was secretly assembled to conduct an investigation under the cover of a decree prohibiting entry into The Chasm. All this was done in order to delay the crisis brewing underground if necessary. Since Muning is a special representative of the Ministry, he cannot directly ask for help and is not allowed to talk about many of The Chasm's features. Therefore, in order to explain in a roundabout way how to get into The Chasm, he could only "warn" not to do something, and his "can't" actually means "can."

At the top of Glaze Peak, the Skyfeather, one of six items needed to open the secret treasury in The Chasm, can be found. In addition, one day, the Adventurers' Guild sent the Traveler and Paimon to help a researcher from Fontaine, Patrice. Patrice was researching Vibro-Crystal Harmonics, the process of stimulating the elemental energy within gems and crystals, and using this elemental power as a source of energy. Not long before, someone in The Chasm tried to activate gems and discovered that a certain wondrous resonance could occur between special
When the Transmitter Crystal, one half of the Vibro-Crystal set, is stimulated in a certain way, it releases a certain energy that triggers a resonance with the Receiver Crystal half. The two energies from the Vibro-Crystals stack and multiply one another many, many times over, which Patrice called "harmonics." The researcher developed a hypothesis, but needed help to test this hypothesis in practice. Thanks to the Traveler, Patrice was able to complete his research.

customize.text: Lumberpick Valley

Lumberpick Valley is located northeast of The Chasm, between Fuao Vale and Lingju Pass. After the mines were closed, the Treasure Hoarders settled in the place, just like they did in The Chasm's Surface. At first, they simply stole ore and Glaze Sand Crystals for smuggling, but then they became so bold that they occupied the old warehouses left by the miners and began making cheap jewelry for sale. Although such low-quality jewelry could only fool gullible tourists who had never been to Liyue or people who only learned from books, the Millelith decided to clear The Chasm of Treasure Hoarders. In order to carry out the operation, a squad of Millelith began posing as Treasure Hoarders. They also learned that the leaders of the Treasure Hoarders were in contact with the Fatui and were possibly preparing a deal related to the trade of dangerous materials. The Millelith informant reported that the Fatui were buying something from the Treasure Hoarders and paying with large amounts of Mora and military supplies, but he only found food and household items, so it was probably a trick to distract them. Just when the undercover squad had everything they needed for a major offensive and were just about to expose them, the soldiers were discovered by the Traveler and Paimon, who mistook them for ordinary Treasure Hoarders. Joining forces, the Traveler and the Millelith went to Lumberpick Valley to capture a food camp in the southeast, a weapons camp in the east, and an alchemy camp in the northeast. By taking these camps by surprise, they completely cut off their supplies and were able to attack the camp where the main transaction between the Fatui and the Treasure Hoarders was to take place. But even after defeating them, the Millelith only found deals in the works to buy food.

In the Treasure Hoarders' camp, one of the items needed to open the Millelith's treasury, the Cup of Commons, as well as a fragment of a treasure map leading to the passage between Glaze Peak and Tiangong Gorge, can be found.
One day, the Traveler and Paimon met an engineer from the Fontaine Research Institute and a colleague of the researcher Patrice, whom they had met earlier, Anatole. When Patrice had problems with the distribution of the budget and funding for the test site, he took all the remaining funds, the experimental equipment, and disappeared. Everyone said that he was completely tired of the Institute, so he left, taking all Mora with him. But then he showed up as if nothing had happened, and even with the results of an experiment in which he had been helped by the Traveler and Paimon. Since his presence and purpose in The Chasm for the experiment were illegal, and the data obtained was excessively detailed and complete, the Institute decided that the data was pulled out of thin air and sent Anatole to reproduce the experiment. With the help of the Traveler, the results were confirmed, but the head of the Institute declared that there was no economic benefit to the study, and Patrice was unable to obtain further funding. Anatole and Patrice returned to The Chasm to experiment with practical applications for the technology. Anatole came up with the idea of connecting the Receiver Crystal to the rope-pull mechanism that controls the lighting, and then all that would be left to do was remotely activate the Transmitter Crystal to turn off the ceiling light. It would also be possible to attach the Receiver Crystal to things that people lose, so that they could be easily found using the Transmitter Crystal.

customize.text: Fuao Vale

A long time ago, Rex Lapis raised the rock's spirit to the surface, carved a dragon out of it, gave it eyes so that it could look at the world, and made a deal with the spirit. This King of Geo Vishaps was called Azhdaha. The Geo Archon allowed Azhdaha to live among people, but if the day ever came when he brought ruin to order, he would once again be sealed in the dark. After that, the dragon accompanied Rex Lapis on his travels and fought shoulder to shoulder with him in numerous battles. Over time, due to erosion, Azhdaha's memory faded into obscurity. He forgot the face of his old friend, and the memory of Liyue's protection crumbled like sand. Once whole, Azhdaha became irascible and aggressive. Erosion made him even more savage, and no matter how he struggled, he lost the ability to coexist with humanity and lost all reason. To stop the erosion, the Lord of Geo shared some of his power with Azhdaha, but it was all in vain. One day, the dragon attacked miners in The Chasm who were shaking the Ley Lines with ore mining, causing Azhdaha to suffer. The Geo Archon was forced to fight his friend and hid him from people by sealing him underground. Traces of the battle between Rex Lapis and the Dragon Lord are still visible in the Fuao Vale. Short-term earthquakes sometimes occur in The Chasm, which old miners called "Azhdaha's Breath." After the battle between the Geo Archon and Azhdaha, the Dragonfall, an incredibly rare ore used in forging, was born. The majority of regular crystals are formed in high-temperature environments. Dragonfall, on the other hand, is formed as a product of elemental reactions. Even after thousands of years, the Geo Vishap continued to sense it and tried to find his old friend through it.

In the vale, unique rock pillars, which, according to legend, remained after this ancient battle, can be found. Under the influence of explosions and blows with heavy objects, they create a resonant quake with other similar pillars and Geo Constructs. In this location, the Sundial of Ages, necessary for the offering to the ancient treasury of the Millelith, can be found.
In the Fuao Vale, located at the northernmost point of The Chasm, there is an ancient sacrificial altar. Several thousand years ago, these ritual grounds were buried beneath the earth amidst a cataclysm that tore heaven and earth asunder, and a meteorite fell. When the Spiritstone fell into The Chasm, the altar resurfaced, and the resolutions caused by close friends fighting for opposing goals, Rex Lapis and Azhdaha, forced it to appear before the world again. Nonetheless, those who once frequented this place are no more.

customize.text: The Surface

The Chasm is the largest mine in Liyue, and second only to Mt. Tianheng in terms of age. It is an area with complex terrain, a unique ecosystem, and geological conditions caused by a meteorite impact around six thousand years ago. The surface of The Chasm is full of cliffs, while the underground mines are filled with bottomless gorges and caverns. For centuries, the area was famous for its ore and mineral mining until an accident in the mines forced The Chasm to be closed. Even after the miners evacuated, there were still many elevators, temporary housing, and rock blasting cannons scattered throughout the area. After the miners left The Chasm, they were replaced by the Fatui, who served the Harbinger Pulcinella, and the Treasure Hoarders, who mined the ore in search of quick Mora. In addition, special spoutrocks can be found in the area, caused by the geology and containing air under high pressure. Such rocks make jumps stronger and allow movement on complex and multi-level terrain.

customize.text: Cinnabar Cliff

The highest point of The Chasm is the Cinnabar Cliff, located in the westernmost part of Liyue, on the border with Sumeru. Elemental reactions within The Chasm over a long history have colored the soil a wonderful purple-red. On the cliff, Tang Wuchou, who introduces himself as a true disciple of the 320th Guhua Clan generation, can be met. On one of the peaks, he found several Qingxin flowers growing and took them under his care, intending to build a lovely and great Glaze Lily garden, far from the structures and standards of the norm. When the Traveler and Paimon plucked one of the flowers, the Flower of Farsight, which needed to be offered to the ancient treasury, Tang Wuchou attacked them but was easily defeated. When the Traveler and Paimon did not believe him about belonging to the Guhua Clan because of his Treasure Hoarders' clothes, he showed them a jade pendant as proof. This pendant was sold to him by an old friend when they parted, and as soon as Tang Wuchou began to wear it, an Adeptus appeared to him on the first night and taught him the secret arts of the Guhua Clan. And every time he practiced martial arts, Tang Wuchou felt a slight tingling in his head, which he took as evidence of the development and expansion of consciousness. The Traveler and Paimon realized that because of the strange pendant filled with Geo energy, the man believed that he was a disciple of the Guhua Clan, and this began to drive him crazy. If he continued to wear the pendant and go into a fantasy world, trouble would definitely happen to him. In order to save Tang Wuchou, the Traveler and Paimon exchanged the pendant for a chicken egg, in which the man saw a huge gem.

To find out more about the pendant, the Traveler and Paimon approached Old Chou, a jade merchant who offered to help them find hidden treasures. Old Chou and Tang Wuchou were once Treasure Hoarders, but after a profitable deal in The Chasm, their paths diverged. One day, Chou was found by his former colleagues, who threatened to buy up their low-grade jewelry and sell it in Liyue. He was forced to slash his prices and operate at a loss until the Treasure Hoarders were finally arrested by the Millelith with the help of the Traveler. One of the items that Chou sold was a jade pendant. The merchant had hoped to get a fortune for it, but Tang Wuchou took notice and convinced him to sell it for cheap. The pendant's material was imbued with elemental energy, and if a person without a Vision came into contact with it, their personality would change. The description reminded Chou of the legend of "Smaragdus Jadeite." It was rumored that this material was incredibly valuable, but caused certain inconveniences to its owners and concealed ominous omens. Smaragdus Jadeite is one of the treasures of the Adepti, in which their power is contained, and not every person can withstand prolonged contact with this mineral without harm to their health. The "Seven Mountain Treatises" states that this substance springs forth from Stonemarrow within the mountains and will bring disaster to any mere mortals who touch it. Best case scenario, they fall ill, worst-case scenario, they'll suffer great changes in personality, and their illness will only ever get worse. The Traveler and Paimon had already encountered Smaragdus Jadeite once, when they created an abode inside a teapot with the help of the Adeptal powers.

To make amends with his old friend, Old Chou offered to dig up the treasure in his field and give it to Tang Wuchou. Although the man thought the treasure was ugly, he promised to take a bottle of wine and go talk to the merchant, and he left the jade pendant with the Traveler as a token of his gratitude. After the Traveler and Paimon rescued a missing miner from The Chasm who had been eating mushrooms for over a year, he went to Cinnabar Cliff and, mistaking Tang Wuchou's Qingxin flowers for mushrooms, began eating them. Thanks to the intervention of the Traveler and Paimon, the conflict was resolved. Tang Wuchou realized that he was guarding Qingxing, not Glaze Lilies, and the miner realized that he was trying to eat flowers, not mushrooms.

On the border of the two nations, you can find the Sumpter Beastlord, a huge Sumpter Beast that scares the living daylights out of anyone who sees it. When it sleeps, it can seem like a few hills, and if one enters its territory, the Sumpter Beast will rush towards the intruder as soon as it sees them.

At the center of the crater formed by the meteorite that fell on the lands of Liyue millennia ago, the entrance to the underground mines of The Chasm can be found. Several years ago, miners dug up a "thing" deep within the mines, which led to a serious incident. When the mines were evacuated, a long line of wounded people formed and were carried back to the surface, and the wounded miners were more mentally injured than physically. They recovered after a few days of being brought to the surface, but even this was enough for the Qixing to intervene. The authorities decided to seal the entrance to the mines with a magical barrier, the Seven-Stars Array, and any movement within The Chasm required special permission. When The Chasm exploration team, with the help of Traveler and Paimon, who were sent on behalf of the Adventurers' Guild, destroyed all the Bedrock Keys, the barrier was finally lifted. Since the destruction of the array was damage to public property, Muning reported the damage in advance, as if the Bedrock Keys had been destroyed before the group arrived.

Near The Chasm's mines' entrance, a pile of unassuming rocks can be found. This is the Millelith Memorial, which has stood for five hundred years unfalteringly. The Chasm is protected by the Millelith, so every time people descend into the mine, the miners say a prayer near the rocks in honor of the heroic souls of those who went down to protect them: <color=#ffffffd9>"O great Millelith heroes, please see to it that The Chasm does not act up these few days! And may we be safe and sound as we descend into the mines this time, and may those comrades of ours who no longer come to mine also fare well in their respective paths. Protect us, brave Millelith, protect us..."</color> The fallen Millelith have long since turned into elements and become one with the mine, so when the miners pray for protection, they are also paying homage to The Chasm itself. The ancients said that "the earth has a spirit, and the elements have souls." Those who sacrificed their lives so that others might live watch over them in this way. This memorial is believed to have been erected by a Millelith, who fell from a great height while helping to rescue miners while fighting off enemies. He seriously injured his spine, and the injury left him unable to use his legs or arms. But the soldier did not despair, and instead trained himself as a doctor and helped many others with similar injuries. It is said that he erected this memorial in memory of his comrades after he received a Vision.

The story of a Millelith would gradually fade from history, being replaced with tales of the "Millelith's treasure" and the "Yaksha's inheritance." According to legend, anyone who places six items lost in The Chasm before the memorial will be rewarded with gifts from the Millelith. Among the six items are: the "Helm of Warding," which may defend one from rockfalls; the "Cup of Commons," made to memorialize comradery; the "Skyfeather," the symbol of lofty ideals; the "Warrior's Spear," used to fend off the foe; the "Flower of Farsight," which grew upon the cliffs of The Chasm; and the "Sundial of Ages," used to remember the bygone past. It is believed that the Flower of Farsight will only make itself known to those with such lofty desires that they might seem crazy to some, and thus is not something ordinary people can witness. The Skyfeather can only be obtained from an eagle on a certain mountaintop, and the Sundial of Ages would be remembered by all, such that time's passage would not cause it to lose its luster. It is said that the Cup of Commons will regain its dignity someday, even if it is obtained by bandits and crooks, or becomes a lowly guest at a humble table, and that the Helm of Warding is said to rest in the room of an ordinary person, yet may not be summoned forth by anyone but a hero. The Warrior's Spear is rumored to have been set up on a lone cliff, awaiting a valiant soul equal to it. Only then will it be content to once again enter time's eternal flow. One of the offerings, the Helm of Warding, can be found near the Millelith Memorial. The stones are inscribed with the names of Millelith warriors in several rows, and below is a message from the Millelith:

When the Qixing sent an exploration team to study the "thing" below, they set up their first camp in Ad-Hoc Main Tunnel. Him being an ecologist of the Amurta Darshan, with his area of study including minerals and biology, meant he might have been interested in photography of fossils, strange objects in the mines' bodies of water, and glowing mushrooms.

After completing all the tasks related to these subjects, Khedive gifted the Traveler a letter of introduction to the Akademiya aimed to enlist the help of House of Purbiruni as a token of gratitude. Khedive's tasks were to study the changes that had occurred in the life forms of The Chasm, as well as to study any life forms of paleontological interest. One of these fossils of paleontological interest can be found southeast of the Ad-Hoc Main Tunnel. Since the researcher had to pay the salaries of all the miners in the camp out of his own pocket, it was important for him to achieve success and share the results of his research with the historical community in Liyue.

Aside from Khedive, the party included the adventurer Zhiqiong from Mingyun Village. Being from the last generation of miners, she had worked in The Chasm herself and knew it like the back of her hand, so the Ministry of Civil Affairs hired her to map the underground section. When The Chasm was closed due to an accident, the girl became an adventurer. Zhiqiong constantly wondered what significance mere mortals who were not blessed with the gods' grace and perhaps came into this world by accident had compared to those who had the gaze of the gods. They dreamed of continuing to work hard so as not to be entangled in the misery of the poverty of this world, and hoped that the daily efforts and hard work would not be forgotten.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Think of those herb gatherers who dangle from the top of the cliffs, miners who work day in and day out despite the potential threat of earthquakes, and workers who drive every nail into a giant ship multiple floors in height... If their hard work is dismissed as mundane and unworthy of remembrance, I can't help but question the gods' logic to favor some of our wishes and dignities over others."</color>

Although the adventurer did not possess a Vision, she bravely descended into the dangerous depths of The Chasm to map the places she had visited. Zhiqiong wanted the underground landscapes of the mines to bear her name, and to show ordinary people how far a mortal who was not chosen by the gods could go, and what kind of history they could leave behind.

The safety specialist, Jinwu, was in charge of repairing and maintaining the exploration team's equipment. She had been taught everything by her father when she was ten years old: how to set up camp, how to make crystal lamps, and how to operate mining equipment. As her father gradually grew older and his eyes weakened, it fell to her alone to be responsible for the safety of the equipment in the mines. Although she had a daughter of her own, the latter went to study in Sumeru, while Jinwu took care of the children of the miners who had died. She worked in the mines for about twenty years and became a real big sister to the miners, including Zhiqiong. In order to facilitate the exploration of The Chasm, Jinwu gave the Traveler the Lumenstone Adjuvant, which dispels darkness and miasma, destroys mud holes in mines, and lights lamps. The Adjuvant is capable of absorbing the energy from Lucklight Flies, Noctilucous Jade, Lumenstones, and lightstone lamps, and can only be properly used by Vision bearers. The composition of the Lumenstone Adjuvant is similar to the Glaze Sand Crystals and Lumenstone Ore that began to appear in the dark tunnels after the fall of the divine nail. This ore has the magical ability to accumulate energy and emit light, and if listened to closely, sounds similar to sighs can be heard from it. One of the names for this ore is the wishstone, and superstitious miners say that it can miraculously grant a person's wish that they did not even ask for. Lumenspars are similar to Luminous Ore and are a manifestation of the "thing" underground. Due to their structural similarities, crystals, ore, and Adjuvant can resonate with each other, so Jinwu can upgrade the Adjuvant by collecting a certain amount of crystals and ore, allowing it to accumulate more energy and destroy large oozing concretions.

After all the adventures of the Traveler in The Chasm and the stories of the dark mud and monsters of the Abyss, the azure crystals, the nine Black Serpent Knights, the Fatui in trouble, and the glowing mushrooms, Taliesin composed an epic poem that combined his feelings and aspirations. The Underground Waterway of The Chasm is located southwest of the Main Mining Area and is saturated with elemental energy. While fishing, the Traveler caught a strange object from the water and decided to ask Khedive about it. The scholar advised leaving the object near the water's edge and activating it with Hydro. After following the instructions, a Vishap appeared, attracted by the elemental energy. It turned out that the object was algae enriched with Hydro. The content of these elements in the water under The Chasm is so high that such plants could appear in special places where they accumulate. And Vishaps, like other creatures in The Chasm that need the element Hydro, consume these plants to increase their strength. Such algae do not grow under normal conditions unless the body of water is affected by very pure and strong energy, and one day, they could become sentient elemental creatures.

Near the fishing spot, two Black Serpent Knights can be met, one of whom, Edgetho, has an Orb of the Blue Depths, which is needed to open the treasury, and the second one has a letter from Corporal Nikolay to his sister, Katarina. In addition, in the Underground Waterway, two records written in the ancient Abyssal language can be found. Such records dissipate from the light of the Lumenstone Adjuvant. Besides the record, two fossils that interest Khedive are located nearby.

In the southwest of the place, the ruins of an ancient civilization are located, the architecture of which resembles the civilization of Enkanomiya. In these ruins is one of the two bells needed to remove the strange fog in the Nameless Ruins, as well as the Black Serpent Knight, Hyglacg, who has an Orb of the Blue Depths.
When the Traveler and Paimon entered The Chasm Mines, the security specialist, Jinwu, asked them to find a trace of a senior miner, Uncle He. He was one of the unfortunate people who went missing several years ago during The Chasm evacuation, unable to hear the alarm due to deafness. In Ad-Hoc Main Tunnel, old diaries were found in which the miner wrote about the strange Black Magma oozing from underground and unusual mushrooms. When approaching the Black Magma, his thoughts grew jumbled, and his senses became agitated. However, near the Lumenspars, these deleterious effects retreated greatly. This Magma attracted elemental creatures, who began to feed on it, but the man felt that something was wrong and decided to find a place where mushrooms grow. Gradually, the miner began to hear as if someone was calling him and saying that there was water and mushrooms in the depths.

After descending into the Underground Waterway, the Traveler and Paimon discovered a huge hollow tree where Uncle He lived. His skin color had turned dark red, and he kept talking about mushrooms and seemed not to understand questions. After feeding him mushrooms, they were able to take the miner to the exploration team's camp, where he was examined by Khedive. The spores of the mushroom got into the miner's ear canal, which is why his ears were constantly itchy, and with prolonged use, the mushrooms worsened his sanity. When these mushrooms were first found in The Chasm, a scholar wanted to study the effects of long-term use, but no one wanted to participate in the experiment and eat them. Upon study, it turned out that due to the special environment of the mines, the mushrooms began to have hallucinogenic effects, but did not cause irreversible harm to the human body and mind. Khedive cleaned the fungus from Uncle He's body and gave him medicine to restore his nerves, so he should have recovered after a long rest.

At the intersection of the Main Mining Area and the Underground Waterway, the Traveler met with the Ninth Company of the Fatui, led by Staff Sergeant Anton Melnikov. When they arrived at The Chasm, there were sixty-four people in the company, but only Anton, Danila, Temur, and Radomir remained. According to the agreement with the authorities of Liyue, the Fatui's task was to study the cause of the incident in The Chasm and protect people from the black disaster. When the mines were first sealed, trade agreements were concluded between Snezhnaya and Liyue on both sides, and the transfer of the Fatui to The Chasm was one of the additional conditions. The Ninth Company arrived to conduct research and destroy the source of the anomaly, and all information obtained during the investigations was shared between Snezhnaya and Liyue. At first, the residents of Liyue even blessed the squad, since to them, they were heroes sacrificing themselves for others. The Fatui discovered a crystal older than The Chasm itself and found that the black substance was growing in quantity every day. The Ninth Company wanted to use the Mokosh Device, which could theoretically handle the corruption of the Abyss, but an explosion of unknown origin caused the device to overload and fail. As a result of the battles with monsters and the forces of corruption, almost all of the Ninth Company were killed or missing, and supplies were no longer coming down from above. At first, the Fatui made an agreement with the Treasure Hoarders to exchange money and military supplies for food and essential goods, but the contact, Clitopho, disappeared, and the Millelith arrested all the Treasure Hoarders. When the Traveler and Paimon climbed up to the supply point, it turned out that it had long been abandoned, and cooperation with the Fatui had ceased after the incident with the Harbingers and the Overlord of the Vortex, Osial. The cooperation agreement with Snezhnaya was cancelled, the Millelith were forbidden to interact with the Fatui under penalty of arrest, and all Fatui were declared enemy criminals. The leader of the Millelith squad, with whom the Fatui and the Traveler worked together, left Anton a letter informing him of the change in the situation and the hidden provisions. Realizing that they were no longer welcome in Liyue and that the Harbinger Pulcinella had given up relatively low-value assets for more significant endeavors, the Ninth Company decided to retreat. In parting, they asked to find their comrade, Katarina, who had gone in search of her brother, Nikolay.

When Zhiqiong, the Traveler, and Paimon cleared a path to the lower levels, they discovered a floating glowing shard, similar to the divine nail shards that the Traveler had found on Dragonspine. When the miners dug up the shard, Lumenstones began to appear all over The Chasm. After the shard appeared, the changes in the geological structure of the mines began to accelerate: black matter began to appear, covering the stones, dark mud, and oozing concretions began to spread throughout the mines. Dark mud is a mysterious, poisonous substance that erupts from a fissure in the ground, causing a deadly, destructive effect on any organism nearby. The oozing concretion is the core of the dark mud, and only by destroying it can the mud be eliminated. Monsters that find themselves inside the spill of filth become even more ferocious and feed on this energy. The miners who dug up the crystal thought it was a "Wish Granter," and that any wish would come true if they approached it. But the fragment drove the miners mad, and the Qixing was forced to seal the mine. When Zhiqiong came into contact with the fragment, she felt a sense of nausea, like the motion sickness of a carriage or the disorientation of a ship during a storm. She had felt the same way near the dark mud, but she continued to explore the mines despite her deteriorating health. When the Traveler cleared the fragment, it flew away and cleared the way further, and Zhiqiong felt relieved, as if the air had become cleaner again.
In the Stony Halls, the Traveler and Paimon found the miner, Qi Ding, who was looking for a doll for his daughter. This doll was very rare, so he asked his acquaintances to buy one from the Feiyun Commerce Guild and treasured it like the apple of his eye, but one day he lost it. The Traveler and Paimon offered to help the miner find it and took him to the surface to see Muning. While searching for the doll, they found a torn sheet of paper from a notebook:

<color=#ffffffd9>"...I ran into that rock again. I bet it has to do with the sealing of the mine..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"...Now that she's landed a job at the Ministry of Civil Affairs, she needs money on many fronts. I can't afford to have my work interrupted as it was two years ago when they closed the mine."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"...Qi Ding, for your daughter's sake, you have to blow that rock up!"</color>

After examining the box of gunpowder in the Stony Halls, the Traveler and Paimon suddenly noticed a little girl. She introduced herself as the daughter of a miner and refused to go up to the camp, but showed them the location of the lost doll. When she saw the Rifthounds on the way, she wasn't scared but started playing with them. After they returned to the miner, it turned out that Qi Ding had become obsessed with his long stay in the depths of The Chasm, but when he came to the surface, his mind became clear. When the Qixing sealed The Chasm, Qi Ding could not allow the mines to be closed, otherwise, he would lose his job, so he decided to blow up the "Wish Granter." But as soon as he went down and approached the stone, his head suddenly began to hurt, and everything swam before his eyes. It was only when he left the mines that he was able to come to his senses. The doll that Qi Ding asked to find actually belonged to his daughter, but after playing with it for a while, the man began to carry the doll around with him as a talisman. The daughter had long since grown up and worked in the Ministry of Civil Affairs, and the girl that the Traveler and Paimon met was only a reflection of the powers of the "Wish Granter."

Two records left in the ancient Abyssal language can be seen nearby. Not far from this place is a hidden room with three Black Serpent Knights. The Glowing Narrows are located in the southwest of The Chasm, in the deepest part of the mines. To the south of the Glowing Narrows, a strange, huge mushroom called Xamaran is located. Its progenitor is the Sumeru god, Bifrons. Once, with the help of his "children," he controlled the minds of people so that they would worship him. During the Archon War, Bifrons was banished by Al-Ahmar and was forced to find a new home, going to the volcano in Natlan, while Xamaran, who considers Bifrons "his foolish father," separated and went to the underground mines of Liyue. They have had no business with one another for many long years, and Xamaran almost forgot its progenitor's name. Over time, the corrupted energy of the Abyss in the mines became stronger and stronger, and in the fight against it, Xamaran's strength was exhausted. Thanks to the energy of the Lumenstone Adjuvant, some of Xamaran's strength was restored, and he shared the Blessing of Wisdom with the Traveler so that they could cleanse the black mud and destroy the source of the corrupted power. When the land was cleared, the mushroom went into hibernation to gain strength to fight the corrupted energy, shelter its relatives, and reproduce. Around Xamaran, unusual glowing mushrooms, identical to one of the mushroom species growing in Sumeru, can be found. After studying these mushrooms, Khedive came to the conclusion that their luminescence may be the result of absorbing the energy of the shards of the divine nail.

In the Glowing Narrows, the Traveler and Paimon encountered Anton Melnikov's missing comrade from the Ninth Company, Katarina Snezhevna. Katarina is a friend of Lyudochka Snezhevna, whom the Traveler and Paimon rescued in Inazuma and helped start a new life as a shrine maiden. Katya and her younger brother, Corporal Nikolay, grew up in the House of the Hearth, and when Nikolay disappeared into The Chasm, Katya separated from the company to find him. Since Katarina was injured, she asked the Traveler and Paimon to find traces of her brother. During their search, the Traveler and Paimon discovered a fragment of a diary, a bloody chevron, and a note in which the corporal wrote that he had discovered a secret room while escaping from a Ruin Guard. This cave had one exit, but Nikolay did not know where it led. At the end of the note, he wrote that he was noticed by the Black Serpent Knight, and the further fate of the corporal is unknown, although later, the Traveler and Paimon found both the Black Serpent and Nikolay's letter to Katya.

<color=#ffffffd9>"...I've been spotted! Someone's coming. It's a... swordsman... clad in black?"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"...He, no, it... Seems as though even metal bars are no obstacle for it. And just from looking upon it, I know this in my heart..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"...I'm sorry, Katya."</color>

After learning of her brother's fate, Katya decided to hope that her brother had died in battle and not deserted, because then she would have to hunt for the traitor's head, no matter where he hid and no matter how long he hid. And if he died, then as his sister, Katarina was ready to meet the same fate that inevitably befalls every Fatuus, but she would be proud of her brother. When the Traveler and Paimon returned to Katya's camp the next day, she was already gone, and only Nikolay's letter, which she always carried with her, would remain.

The path leading west of the area is blocked by a gate that can be opened with a stone key obtained by defeating the Abyss Lectors at the upside-down city. Beyond the gate are the ruins of an ancient civilization and a divine nail called the Spiritstone. The Traveler has encountered a similar nail on Dragonspine before; they were tools once used by the Heavenly Principles to seal the cracks in Teyvat. The Spiritstone has the ability to cleanse and balance forces that should not be in Teyvat, including the Abyss and forbidden knowledge. When the Traveler and Paimon first came across the Spiritstone, it was tainted with corruption.

During this discovery, Paimon located a stone tablet that looked new and didn't fit with the ruins around it. Carved on the stone tablet were instructions on how to cleanse the Spiritstone, and a warning of the future. After cleansing the crystal, the Traveler was suddenly attacked from beneath the earth by a mechanical
similar to the one in The Serpent's Cave. During the battle, a mysterious woman, a special agent of the Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing, suddenly appeared and shot the Spiritstone at the Ruin Serpent with an arrow. When the divine nail returned to its place, the spread of the filth under The Chasm stopped, and the Qixing opened the mines for work again.

After cleansing the crystal and completing the map of the underground part of The Chasm, Zhiqiong was supposed to go to the surface, as her condition was getting worse. The Traveler was chosen for the expedition because they could control the elements and had already encountered a similar nail on Dragonspine. But for ordinary people who did not have a Vision, the mutation in the mines could be a deadly danger. Those who were near the source of the mutation either slowly lost contact with the world and went crazy, or weakened so much that they died. Despite the orders of the exploration team and her condition, Zhiqiong escaped. Not far from the Spiritstone, the Traveler found the last camp where she had stayed, but the girl was no longer there. In her place, on the ground, was a letter in which Zhiqiong apologized to all the members of the team and said goodbye to them. She wrote that her journey was far from over and that she would continue her adventure, following the open path to the end.

<color=#ffffffd9>"But still, I can't help wondering if those famed adventurers like Leonard, Stanley, and Roald have ever witnessed the same marvel as I — the stone halls of old crawling into the darkness, the dark-purple mud gushing out like lava, the translucent, azure crystals floating in the air, the damaged stone tablets carved with maps of ancient places, and so many other indescribable wonders... Would those great adventurers have backed out for fear of danger, or would they have acted as recklessly as I, persisting in pursuing the inscrutable secrets of the world — even at the price of their common and less-dignified lives?"</color>

Millennia ago, when Sumeru was ruled by Greater Lord Rukkhadevata, the Dendro Sovereign, Apep, became corrupted with forbidden knowledge, a truth that did not belong to Teyvat and came from the very bottom of the Abyss. The elemental life that flourished in Apep's body was almost completely destroyed by the apocalypse, and the remaining creatures left the dragon's body in order to survive. One of the creatures living in the Dendro Dragon believed that the apocalypse was a part of them, and therefore, it was important to preserve it. The other creatures did not agree with it, and it left Sumeru and went to the bottomless depths to the east of Sumeru, to a black place from which there is no return, The Chasm. The Greater Lord, together with this creature, created the Fire Seed, which mimicked how the Dendro Dragon's "Heart of Oasis" operated. The Heart of Oasis was Apep's source of power. With the Seed, the Heart of the Oasis could be reactivated, so the Dendro Dragon would begin to recover. Rukkhadevata promised that one day the apocalypse would come and all memories of it would be blurred, with the creature being the only one to retain those memories.

As the divine nail in The Chasm is able to balance the power of the Abyss and the forbidden knowledge, the apocalypse within the creature was altered and hidden deep within the dark mud. With the power of the Greater Lord, the creature was able to survive for millennia, transforming the power of the apocalypse with the nail and depriving itself of a chance to be saved. As Rukkhadevata promised, she destroyed the forbidden knowledge, but it cost her her life, and her successor, Lesser Lord Kusanali, was forced to erase her from Irminsul entirely, destroying all memory of her existence. And although Kusanali did not remember the agreement, with the help of the creatures living in Apep, she discovered the last memories of the apocalypse. Although it was too late for the creature that kept this memory, the Lesser Lord returned its consciousness home and saved the Dendro Dragon.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Our past has been saved, and our future has been ensured.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>It's enough for me just knowing that they will return home."</color>

In the Glowing Narrows, two inscriptions written in the ancient language of the Abyss and the Black Serpent Knights Rethel, Herger, and Roneth can be found, they all each hold their own respective Orb of the Blue Depths. Near one of the inscriptions is the last fossil that Khedive is interested in. On these fossils, representatives of marine fauna can be seen, which proves that before the formation of The Chasm, there was an ocean in this place. Fossils that were preserved in such good condition could only have formed under special conditions: they had to be buried very quickly underground. Since all the fossils were at a certain altitude, were close to each other, and formed in a very short period of time, this indicated major and rapid environmental changes, such as a strong earthquake.

customize.text: Yu Valley

Legend has it that about six thousand years ago, when Rex Lapis was still young, a meteorite fell from the sky into the barren plains west of Liyue. These plains were transformed into a huge and deep chasm in the wake of that star's descent. Beautiful and limitless jade emerged from within, and it became the foundation for a thousand years of industrial mining in Liyue thereafter. As most know, wordless stones harbored soul and spirit, and in manners and times not witnessed by mortal eyes, they watched and listened to the ley lines' pulses, the echoes of the alpine springs, and the slow but inexorable movements of the mountains. But unlike the ordinary but enduring stone of the earth, the fragments of the meteorite that fell from heaven had a proud and agitated temper. Later, when countless gods and rulers
over the appointed celestial seats, and the very stars and abyss themselves faded, tragedy and evil embarred the breath of the waters and mountains. The fallen star could bear this no longer, and heedless of the great chasm's persuasions to stay, it leaped away, away towards the heavens. As it returned to the skies, the heavenly jade left behind a deep pit, within which humans would build great cities and mighty fortresses, finding refuge and shutting themselves in with the leftover inheritance of that fallen star. Another legend has it that it was not a meteorite but a solar chariot that raced across the earth. When three Moon Goddesses were martyred in a calamity, the solar chariot fell into a deep gorge. Fortunately, the device was repaired, and the sun shone through the darkness again. Although it was returned to its constant westward cycle, a single piece would forever remain behind. When they moved to the city, they would grind that fragment into crystals and sell it to someone who knew its value.

A long time ago, when The Chasm was still known as Yu Valley, there was an ancient civilization whose settlements stretched from peak to peak, and life was centered around the mines. The people of the valley communicated with the heavens through jade. Celestia's
whose beauty was pure as moonlight, would lead and protect people. There's a legend that the jade scattered among the rocks came from the azure heavens. Celestia's envoys bestowed these beauteous gems upon the early residents and guided them to build a ritual jade altar that reached the heavens, so that they may receive the blessings and curses from above. But the ancient sin buried beneath their feet and hidden beneath the deepest mines was unknown to mortals. After the war between the Primordial One and the Second Who Came, a Spiritstone fell from the heavens onto the mines — a huge, sky-blue crystal pillar that sealed away the filth. After the war, the angels fell silent and stopped guiding the people, and due to changes in the geology, the people of Yu Valley moved far north, founding Chenyu Vale.

When the Glazed Sand Crystal appeared in The Chasm after a meteorite fell from the sky, some of the indigenous tribes began to collect these crystals and make porcelain from them. Later, these tribes would make blood pacts with the Lord of Geo's Yaksha and join him. They abandoned their lands and customs and moved east to the harbor of Liyue. Accustomed to city life, they gradually forgot about their past and became Shenglu Hall, one of Liyue's Eight Trades. Abandoning their old warlike roots, they made a living by making and selling porcelain, and participated in the great battles to subdue Azhdaha and repel the black calamity, making great contributions to Liyue.

customize.text: The Cataclysm

Five hundred years ago, the Vinster King of the
without gods tore the veil of sin, and hordes of dark beasts from Khaenri'ah invaded the seven nations of Teyvat, marking the beginning of the Cataclysm. Liyue suffered the same fate, and under the command of Rex Lapis, the Millelith fought to the last breath. As the Abyss gushed into this world from the depths of The Chasm, the Geo Archon entrusted the Millelith with the evacuation of the locals and the protection of the mines. Some soldiers remained to cover the retreat and hold the front line near The Chasm. The Millelith's commander died in the line of duty, as did part of his troop. To ensure that the afflicted civilians could safely escape and to maintain their honor in the eyes of the Lord of Geo, helmet-clad troops of the front line took the lead, pointing their spears towards the Abyss and charging into battle. But these beasts were incredibly ferocious, and the situation on the battlefield was dire. At the decisive moment, the four-armed Yaksha,
arrived to help the Millelith. The Yakshas had long served the Lord of Geo and fought demons, but due to the remains of curses, dead gods, and beasts, their bodies and minds were corroded by karma. When Bosacius went to The Chasm, he had already lost his mind and forgotten his name, but the aura of that battle attracted him. According to rumors, the Yaksha defended The Chasm to atone for eternal sins, to gain forgiveness for the cowardice and weakness he once showed. Be that as it may, when there was no hope, Bosacius distracted the monsters and turned the tide of the battle.

When the surface of The Chasm was destroyed in one of the battles, a mysterious underground palace was revealed underneath. According to observations, the monsters approaching it became weaker, so the soldiers assumed that some force rested underground, capable of suppressing the monsters of the Abyss. Together with other soldiers, the four-armed Yaksha descended lower and lower into the depths of The Chasm. Ordinary mortals who fought side by side with Bosacius could not escape the harmful influence of karma or the suffering from murder. To avoid being consumed by the darkness of constant killing, the Millelith soldiers used a timepiece to silently mark the passage of time during each battle. They fixed a unified marching pace and schedule so that one squadron of mortal soldiers would take the battlefield as the one before them retreated. This cycle of advance and retreat continued all the way to the depths of The Chasm.

One of the fighters, a human with training in the magic arts, Boyang, had an
given to the family by the Adeptus Sea Gazer. This relic was capable of sealing monsters. Boyang wanted to take some of the Millelith to the underground palace to lure the monsters as deep as possible. Using the Fantastic Compass, he and Bosacius recreated the seal from the inside, and Boyang's brother helped them from the outside to make the seal whole. Thanks to their sacrifice, The Chasm was safe, but Boyang, the Yaksha, and the Millelith that followed them were trapped. The monsters were unable to move, and most were destroyed, but despite their victory, the Millelith could not escape. Over time, the soldiers died, and Bosacius and Boyang were left alone. Before his death, the four-armed Yaksha's mind cleared, and he remembered his comrades. When Boyang was all alone, he had a vision of his house, wife, and children. They approached him, then passed through, and disappeared. His thoughts were becoming increasingly confused, and sometimes he felt hatred that all this suffering had fallen on him and not on his brother, but he was still glad that his younger brother had survived. Boyang did not escape from The Chasm, no one on the surface knew the name of the four-armed Yaksha, and Boyang's brother, who returned home, was never the same again and eventually lost his mind. Their names were forgotten, but thanks to their sacrifice, the soldiers defeated the monsters of the Abyss and saved Liyue.

At a time when the world was flooded with dark, vicious blood, a beautiful flower bloomed on the ancient cinnabar cliffs, and not even the smallest smidge of mud stained it. One of the Millelith born under the shadow of Mt. Tianheng entrusted his life to the four-armed Yaksha and rushed into the glowing depths. He was not afraid of the shadowed road of the darkest pits, the stony crystal halls, the defilement arising from the depths, or the twisted beasts in the depths of the mountain. The only thing he feared was being lost and forgotten. He left the girl, the daughter of steep mountains and glazed sand, a beautiful flower as a memento, a ward against forgetting.

<color=#ffffffd9>"The only thing I truly fear is to be lost and forgotten."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Should ill fate dictate that I am to be buried in some nameless place, do not forget me."</color>

But the young woman born among the mountain peaks remained forever in the bottomless depths. The cataclysm the mountaineers had not yet seen with their own eyes was a foreign and abstract concept for them, but she could not stand aside when so many Millileth willingly went to their deaths. One night, the stubborn young woman stole a snow-white bow inlaid with a precious gem from her father, the tribal chief, and then followed the Millileth on a campaign. While she was preparing to never see the light again, the precious gems on the bow emitted a glow. According to the legends of the people of the mountains, the dark bats she felled with every shot, and the giant tortoise of the dark ooze, she nailed to the ground. The magnificent bow danced like the clouds themselves, its arrows' cold gleam tearing through blighted beast-flesh. No deluge of filth from the abyss, nor twisted demon from the warped depths, no incomprehensible terror could make her heart quail, or force her to retreat. These tunes would change and shift with the passage of time like dawn's glow, even to this day, yet she who owned the bow would never come back.

<color=#ffffffd9>"The only thing I truly fear is to be lost and forgotten."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Should ill fate dictate that I am to be buried in some nameless place, do not forget me."</color>

There are eight gates in Liyue, eight key nodes in Liyue's Ley Lines: Life, Death, Repose, Concealment, Initiation, Terrain, Fright, and Injury. They can be used to direct the Ley Lines' energy. If the Ley Lines become corrupted, the fetor seeps into the world, infecting people and bringing great danger to the nation. The Seven-and-Eight-Gates Method, famously used by the Eight Adepts during the sanctification of Tao Dou, is a secret art used in such a case, which can suppress evil spirits and even gods. The seven gates are the requirement for activating the array. The array master will select one gate from the eight to subdue evil, cutting off its exit path by using the Ley Lines' power to obfuscate themselves. The gate would disappear from the Ley Lines completely, never to be seen again — taking the banished evil along with them. As the state of the Ley Lines is intricately linked to human activity, the gates' locations are subject to change over time. The Gate of Injury symbolizes wounds and loss, and is one of the three gates of great misfortune, along with the Gates of Death and Fright. That is why it appeared in The Chasm, where the Abyss spilled out thousands of years ago, and where the Millelith and the Yaksha Bosacius sacrificed themselves during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.text: Requiem of the Echoing Depths

After the Traveler and Paimon cleansed the Spiritstone in the mines, the Qixing reopened The Chasm for mining. Once, one of the miners saw a group of hilichurls that, as if in a trance, went into the depths of The Chasm without even noticing him. After starting to watch the hilichurls closely, he noticed that this was happening over and over again, and these hilichurls never returned. The miners began to worry that they were in danger, so they asked the Adventurers' Guild to investigate the unusual occurrence. The case of the hilichurls in The Chasm fell to the Traveler and Paimon, and after descending to the upside-down city where the hilichurls were seen, they met
one of the surviving Khaenri'ahns, doomed to immortality. Before the fall of Khaenri'ah, he was the captain of the royal guard, but was unable to save his kingdom. After the Cataclysm and his journey with the Traveler's twin in search of fate, he began hunting the Abyss Order, among whom were many survivors of Khaenri'ah who had used the power of the Abyss. His pursuit of one of the Abyss Heralds led him into the depths of The Chasm through a special teleportation network, and so he believed that the Abyss Order might be hiding there.

Dainsleif initially mistook the upside-down city for Khaenri'ah, as the kingdom was built on the ruins of a similar ancient civilization. Near the city, he felt that the environment weakened the curse placed upon him and the hilichurls. For centuries, he had suffered daily from the curse, but there he suddenly felt a small amount of relief from this suffering. The curse of immortality denied death to those afflicted with it, but the body and soul would continue to be eroded until they were virtually nonexistent, even if "death" was not the form that this erosion took. When the hilichurls realized that the end was nigh for them, they instinctively sought a calm and dark place to say goodbye to centuries of suffering, and a place where the power of the curse was weakened was best suited for this.

After heading to the upside-down city, Dainsleif, the Traveler, and Paimon were attacked by a group of Black Serpent Knights, former members of the Khaenri'ahn royal guard who had been driven mad by the curse and the Abyss, turned into empty husks. One of the knights standing in the distance seemed familiar to Dainsleif and seemed to want to say something, but he soon disappeared. Inside the upside-down city, they encountered more Black Serpent Knights who were protecting the hilichurls, whose end was near. The familiar knight appeared again and ordered the others to retreat, and Dainsleif recognized him as Halfdan, once a young warrior from the royal guard. On the day of Khaenri'ah's fall, the Twilight Sword ordered Halfdan to protect the people of Khaenri'ah at all costs, and even after the Cataclysm and the corruption of the curse, the guards continued to carry out this order as they saw the people of the kingdom in the hilichurls. In the upper levels of the city, Dainsleif and the Traveler discovered an inverted fountain, the water of which had a "cleansing" effect and weakened the curse. But even the fountain could not completely remove the curse: it was woven into the fate of the world itself, and existed on a higher level of reality than the people themselves.

Halfdan appeared again, motioning for Dainsleif and the Traveler to follow him, and went to the hilichurls, who had almost merged with the darkness. Near one of the hilichurls, the Traveler discovered an Inteyvat flower, the Khaenri'ahn national flower, which once bloomed in all corners of the nation. Its bloom lasted only two weeks, and if the flower was picked and taken away from Khaenri'ah, the petals stopped growing and hardened. Only after the flower returned to its native soil did the petals become soft again and eventually turn to dust. To the people of Khaenri'ah, the Inteyvat was a symbol for a wanderer far from home, signifying the tenderness of the homeland. In addition, this flower was worn in Lumine's hair. Upon touching the flower, the Traveler saw their twin discussing with an Abyss Herald the ritual to revive Khaenri'ah using the device underneath the fountain. Dainsleif was certain that the revival of his homeland and the lifting of the curse were impossible, and attempting to forcibly dispel it would only lead to more suffering, so they hurried to stop the Abyss Order from trampling the will of Halfdan and the other Black Serpent Knights.

As Dainsleif, the Traveler, and Paimon were returning to the fountain, a bright flash of light suddenly appeared from the room, and their path was blocked by an Abyss Herald. After defeating him, they hurried into the room, but the Abyss Order had already used an amplifying device to increase the cleansing effect of the fountain's water hundreds of times.

Although they expected the ritual to rid them of the curse, the hilichurls, the Black Serpent Knights, and Dainsleif himself only experienced extreme pain. Despite the immense suffering, Halfdan rushed to the device and stopped the process by sacrificing himself. But even after Halfdan's sacrifice, the device remained activated. After destroying all the power supply mechanisms, the device was finally turned off, but there was no more life left in Halfdan. As Dainsleif was about to leave, Halfdan's spirit regained its senses for a moment and was able to bid farewell to the Twilight Sword, dissolving without a trace.

customize.text: Perilous Trail

When the Spiritstone in The Chasm pierced the Ruin Serpent, a counterforce was generated, and a glowing place appeared beneath them, which the Traveler and Paimon decided to explore. Along the way, they met a legal consultant, Yanfei, Itto, and Shinobu of the Arataki Gang, and a secret member of the Department of Civil Affairs, Yelan. Yanfei went to The Chasm because of an old will that mentioned the Fantastic Compass. Many years ago, the author of the will gave this treasure to a determined person in the hopes that it would help him in his time of need. According to an eyewitness, the person who received the treasure took it to The Chasm and has since disappeared, but Yanfei was still determined to fulfill the client's last will. And Itto went after Yanfei to thank her for helping him with a case.

The Chasm is a secret area of ​​Liyue that was sealed off due to an incident in the mines, so Yelan did not want outsiders to be there. She went to The Chasm to search for information about the Cataclysm, during which one of her ancestors disappeared without a trace, and the other lost his mind. Itto and Yelan got into an argument, which resulted in the ground under the nail collapsing, and everyone fell into a strange place under The Chasm mines. Trying to find a way out, they found the entrance to a dungeon and were about to enter it when the
appeared in front of them. He told them to go back and disappeared as suddenly as he appeared. After passing through the dungeon, Yanfei, Yelan, Itto, Shinobu, the Traveler, and Paimon found themselves in the same place they had come from, although they were sure that they had not turned anywhere. Even the auxiliary member of the Arataki Gang, the evil-exorcising bull Ushi, couldn't find the exit, and the hole through which they first entered the cave had disappeared. The Traveler tried to call Xiao for help, but even the Adeptus couldn't hear them.

When the team realized they would have to spend some time in the cave, they decided to take a rest. To Paimon, it felt like twenty days had already passed, while to the Traveler, it felt like only one day. Despite the time spent in The Chasm, none of them were hungry or tired. Suddenly, Yelan discovered a new path, at the end of which was a hidden passage. Entering the dungeon, they heard echoes of a battle and saw an illusion of Xiao. The Adeptus sounded wounded, but did not want them to find him, and warned that something was wrong with the dungeon.

When the Traveler solved all the riddles in the dungeon, the floor on one of the stone platforms disappeared, and the team decided to head down there. In the cave they ended up in, they found the ruins of an ancient civilization and a sealed door. Itto wanted to knock the door down with his weight, but it turned out that it was opened by a special mechanism. Inside the room behind the door were people trying to drive Itto away, holding bowls of beans that the oni can't stand. When Shinobu decided to open the door, she saw her mother trying to force her to work as a maiden at the Grand Narukami Shrine, and Yanfei saw a civil matter that put her in a difficult position. Realizing that the room was showing the fears of the one who opened the door, Yelan refused to open it, as she didn't believe that the path would lead them to Xiao, and she didn't want others to see the secrets she encountered while working for the head of the Qixing, Ningguang. The Traveler was the last to open the door, and when they entered the room, the door closed and didn't open again. In the room, the Traveler saw the darkness of the Abyss, which had taken their sibling. Although the team had not felt tired or hungry before, they suddenly felt sleepy and decided that they would eat and rest for an hour to prevent another wave of hunger and fatigue.

After resting in the camp, Yanfei guessed that they were in a chaotic place: they saw people and objects that should not be there, and time stopped for their bodies. And it was as if the place was deliberately trying to lure them into helping the Conqueror of Demons, although he was not there. This place was beyond rational thought, and the time and space in the dungeon were chaotic, which led to the idea that Xiao had not gone down the same path as them. And his status was transmitted to them through some kind of mind-bending spatial alteration, because the place wanted it. When the team saw Xiao in the dungeon before, the place wanted to lure them into a trap, but the intersection of spaces created a spatial rift. After returning from the dungeon, Yanfei looked around and realized that the chaotic spaces were constantly intersecting, so anything could happen. And if the space-created phenomena were based on imagination, they needed to continue imagining. Yanfei listened closely and heard Xiao's voice behind the illusory wall and was able to convince the Adeptus to join them. After the wounded Xiao rested in the camp, he revealed that he was looking for the Yaksha Bosacius, whose body was never found. The last time they saw each other, Bosacius had already lost his mind. The eldest Yaksha always said that Yakshas were always fighting, and no matter whether they were dead or alive, they should take care of each other and know the fate of each of them until the very end. The Conqueror of Demons's only clue was the story of the battle during the Cataclysm, so he went into The Chasm.

When Xiao realized that the space in The Chasm absorbed souls, he suggested using his power to create a rift and send the others to the surface while he remained in the space, but the others refused to leave the Adeptus behind. Tired of the arguments in the team, Itto decided to punch a hole in the wall and open a new passage, but he used up all his strength and lost consciousness. Leaving Itto with Shinobu and Ushi, the others went into the dungeon, where they saw a huge round plate in the sky, the Fantastic Compass. A smaller version of the compass was stuck in the ground of the dungeon, and turning the arrow on it opened up new passages that led to the same place, but in a different time. At one of these points in time, Xiao encountered the phantom of Bosacius. After saying goodbye to the fallen Yaksha, the team discovered the records of Boyang, Yelan's missing ancestor, who, like Bosacius, was trapped in the subspace of The Chasm. Reaching the end of the dungeon, the team found themselves in a place created from the memories of the Traveler, in which the power of the Abyss deprived them of their family. They saw the Fantastic Compass lying on the ground, and Yelan recognized it as an artifact that her family had owned since ancient times.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Within Yin and Yang, among the five regions, water, fire, wind, and thunder cycle like the seasons.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Grasp the seven heavens from the ground, open wide the three gates, all the world within reach…"</color>

After leaving the dungeon, Yanfei remembered the story from the book in which she found the will. Millennia ago, an Adeptus made a magic device to seal away evil monsters. Later, he made good friends with a human and gave the device to him to use as a catalyst. A few years later, great demons haunted the mountains, and the mortal and the Adeptus joined forces to exorcise them using this same device. The book said: <color=#ffffffd9>"When mortal and adepti powers are combined, one can move the heavens and shake the earth. This contraption is proof that mortals and adepti may coexist, that there is unity between heaven and humanity."</color>

Yanfei, who had the blood of humans and Adepti flowing in her veins, tried to use her powers on the artifact, and it showed how Boyang and Bosacius sealed this space. Since they had both an Adeptus and a mage on their team, Yanfei suggested that Xiao and Yelan use their powers on the Fantastic Compass at the same time. Together, they were able to open a rift in space, but trapped souls began to attack them, and Xiao spent almost all his strength to drive them away and maintain the compass's energy. Realizing that he could no longer use the power of the Fantastic Compass, the Conqueror of Demons moved everyone to the surface, spending the last of his strength and sacrificing himself. When Xiao was about to lose consciousness, he was saved by Rex Lapis.
